alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; Etowah (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 24 at 6:53PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Etowah and Cherokee Counties through 730 PM CDT... At 653 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Cherokee Rock Village, or 9 miles west of Centre, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Centre, Cedar Bluff, Little River Canyon National Preserve, Centre Municipal Airport, Leesburg, Sand Rock, Gaylesville, Tennala, Tabor Road, Cherokee Rock Village, Cornwall Furnace Park, Blanche, Eastern Weiss Lake, Ballplay, Slackland, Western Weiss Lake, Moshat, Ball Flat, Little River Falls and Weiss Dam. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
